content:
We found what I called a very niche spot in the botanic gardens today, and time forgot how to move properly.
He leaned into me first, or maybe I leaned into him, it’s hard to say where one gesture ended and another began. Suddenly we were cuddled on a bench, the world shrinking to the size of us.
It was perfect in a way that stays with you. The kind of thing that makes you understand what people mean when they talk about missing someone who hasn‚Äôt left. I already want more of how easy it felt, how right. The conversations didn‚Äôt need forcing, and the silences didn‚Äôt need filling.
Saying goodbye was harder than it should have been. We’d only just started, and I was already reluctant to end it, like walking away from something I’d only just discovered I needed. The hours we spent there felt both endless and not nearly enough, leaving this strange ache for a moment that‚Äôs already gone.
I keep replaying it, the lean, the ease of conversation, how leaving felt like peeling myself away from something I’d just grown into.
He’s still mine. And I miss him anyway.
summary:
We found what I called a very niche spot in the botanic gardens today, and time forgot how to move properly.

He leaned into me first, or maybe I leaned into him, it’s hard to say where one gesture ended and another began. Suddenly we were cuddled on a bench, the world shrinking to the size of us.

It was perfect in a way that stays with you. The kind of thing that makes you understand what people mean when they talk about missing someone who hasn‚Äôt left. I already want more of how easy it felt, how right. The conversations didn‚Äôt need forcing, and the silences didn‚Äôt need filling.
title: Two Hours That Weren't Nearly Enough

content:
3D Printing Resources A running list of the most useful stuff I‚Äôve found while trying to get prints to not look like cursed spaghetti. Whether you’re calibrating, troubleshooting, or just figuring out what the hell retraction actually does ‚Äî these are worth checking out.
üß† Guides & Knowledge Bases Prusa Knowledge Base
Fantastic tutorials, calibration help, slicer explanations ‚Äî even if you don‚Äôt use Prusa gear.
Teaching Tech Calibration Guides
Absolute goldmine for dialling in everything from e-steps to input shaping.
Cura Docs
If you‚Äôre using Cura, start here before guessing at random settings.
üõ† Forums & Help Prusa Forum
Super active and helpful ‚Äî even the angry rants usually include solutions.
r/FixMyPrint
Post your disasters, get actual feedback. Sometimes even kind feedback.
r/3Dprinting
Big community, good for finding answers, inspiration, or just seeing what other people are breaking. (or being told “bambu lab just works” :P)
üì∫ YouTube Channels Teaching Tech
Practical, clear, and surprisingly in-depth.
CHEP / Filament Friday
Cura tips, Ender 3 fixes, and printable test files.
CNC Kitchen
Print strength testing, slicing experiments, and lots of ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind the ‚Äúwhat.‚Äù
Got a resource I missed? Shoot it through ‚Äî or better yet, let me break my printer trying it and write about it here later.
summary:
3D Printing Resources

A running list of the most useful stuff I‚Äôve found while trying to get prints to not look like cursed spaghetti. Whether you’re calibrating, troubleshooting, or just figuring out what the hell retraction actually does ‚Äî these are worth checking out.

üß† Guides & Knowledge Bases

  • Prusa Knowledge Base
    Fantastic tutorials, calibration help, slicer explanations ‚Äî even if you don‚Äôt use Prusa gear.

  • Teaching Tech Calibration Guides
    Absolute goldmine for dialling in everything from e-steps to input shaping.
title: 3D Printing Resources
